channel.title: Lawrence Logoh's blog
channel.description: Blog posts on Lawrence Logoh's blog

item.title: 2022 Review
item.description:
Overall, this was a good year. Unfortunately, I wasn‚Äôt as productive as I had hoped to be. But, I learned a lot about myself and I made progress. I started learning Go and C, started some new projects, and even lost some weight. I also made some new friends along the way.

While I‚Äôm happy with how the year went in general, I can‚Äôt help but feel like I could have done more. One of the big things I tried to learn was to not take things too seriously. It would feel like the world was ending if I forgot about some homework, for example. I feel like I took it a bit too far, but I think I‚Äôm ready to try a more balanced approach.

I have a good feeling about next year.

item.title: Plans for 2023
item.description:
The basic idea behind this year is to play to my strengths and work on my weaknesses. Min-maxing essentially. A lot of these things are not checklist items that I can just list and tick off. They require step-by-step plans which I will make and follow.

Productivity

I already have a system that I use to manage my life. It‚Äôs just a folder of org files that I like to call my LMS(Life Management System). I plan to rethink and clearly define this system and some of the other systems that I use in conjunction with it. I think doing that will boost my productivity.

Relationships

When it comes to relationships, I‚Äôm very passive. I generally don‚Äôt call or text people until they call me and I don‚Äôt check on people I care about. When I talk to people about how they do it, they say it just comes naturally to them. For whatever reason, that doesn‚Äôt happen for me. But I want to do it, so I‚Äôm going to be more active and intentional about my relationships. This will involve not only calling and checking on people more, but also planning and scheduling activities to spend more time with the people I care about.

Programming

I know some programming languages but I don‚Äôt think I know any of them well enough. So the plan is to become good at two of them at least. Python and Go seem like the obvious choices so I‚Äôll go with them for now. While I do that, I also plan to at least check out Rust and Zig and see how I like them. When it comes to programming domains, I want to become a well-rounded backend developer and improve my frontend skills. Beyond that, I will be trying out other domains like mobile development and OS development(for fun). What this will generally look like is, building a lot of projects that are not necessarily useful to the general public. But if I can do that, I will.

Money

I‚Äôve lived a very comfortable life. Because of that, I haven‚Äôt had to think about money until now. I want to do a lot of cool stuff but money seems to be the thing that I lack to do them. So this year, I‚Äôm going to focus on making money. My humble goal, for now, is at least an average income of $2000/month by the end of the year. I know I can make more than that, but I live in Ghana, and most employers don‚Äôt pay that much.

Other skills

As you can already tell, my writing is shit. I want to write a book next year about a concept I‚Äôm chewing on, so it has to be improved. Another big one is some type of artistic outlet that is not writing. The ones I‚Äôm most attracted to right now are drawing and the electric guitar.

This is a non-exhaustive list but these are the non-negotiables. They come first before everything else.

Happy New Year.

item.title: April 2023 Review
item.description:
Better late than never‚Ä¶right?

This month was rough. I thought it‚Äôd be a piece of cake to handle school, work and personal projects. It wasn‚Äôt.

Money

It‚Äôs nice having a regular stream of income. It‚Äôs liberating in a way. Things I want to try out or buy don‚Äôt seem out of reach. I‚Äôve been winging it when it comes to management though, so I‚Äôll be taking it more seriously going forward.

Productivity

I had some health issues that lasted for about a week. This made it hard to get back into a rhythm but I figured it out eventually. I think I was sufficiently productive, but this is only true when it comes to work and school. My personal projects didn‚Äôt get any love. I think I‚Äôve found my feet at work now so it shouldn‚Äôt be a problem going forward. My school workload is going to reduce next semester too so that should help.

Programming

I haven‚Äôt made much progress on this outside of work. So my JavaScript skills have gone up, but that‚Äôs a consequence of working with it, not intentionally trying to improve. I intend to change that next month. I want to be more intentional about it.

Decent month.

Not the best but I can only look forward and try harder. Hopefully next month will be better.

item.title: August 2023 Review
item.description:
This was a good month. It has been incredibly stressful but I was able to handle it.

Productivity

Satisfactory. Things are getting done.

I‚Äôve also been working on building some good habits. So far it‚Äôs going well.

Relationships

Progress has been made here. I‚Äôve hashed out some issues I neglected. It feels freeing.

It‚Äôs not perfect but the needle was moved.

Programming

Progress was made but not as much as I would‚Äôve liked.

I haven‚Äôt been able to dedicate larger timeblocks due to other priorities1.

Money

No progress here but this is intentional. Trying to take on more work when I can‚Äôt will only hurt me.

It can wait.

Other skills

I‚Äôve put a hold on this until I can dedicate time to them.

When I engage in forms of escapism like watching YouTube, I try make it related to writing, music or other skills I‚Äôm interested in.

Overall, I feel good about this month. I can only hope it‚Äôll increase my stress tolerance.

Good job, Me.

  1. The biggest one being my final year project for university‚Ü©Ô∏é

item.title: Building a static site generator
item.description:
What I was using is a badly written bash script that depends on pup and pandoc. I don‚Äôt mind the pandoc dependency too much as I have it on all my systems anyway. But the script is messy and I‚Äôd rather have something cleaner.

‚ÄúWhy not just use x?‚Äù

Most of the static site generators I‚Äôve seen like Hugo and Jekyll seem too complicated for me. I‚Äôm not saying I can‚Äôt use them, I just felt some friction and thought it would be cool to build my own.

My requirements for the current script were:

  • Must have as few dependencies as possible.
  • Must work on UNIX/UNIX-like systems
  • Must generate an RSS file with all blog posts
  • Must arrange blog posts by date

I didn‚Äôt put too much thought into how the old script worked. I started by writing a function that compiles the markdown files of my blog posts. Everything else came after that. Whenever I hit a roadblock, I looked for a program that could help me. In the end, I had a hacky script that worked but I wasn‚Äôt proud of it. I also started to run into problems when I wanted to add new functionality or change something.

The current script is not as bad. The way that it works is, it assumes every directory(including the root directory) has an src subdirectory. It compiles every markdown file in the src subdirectories to HTML files that live in the directory itself. To get away with not creating an index.html I create an index.md instead and that gets compiled like every other markdown file.

That‚Äôs the core of how it works. If you want the details, read the script.

I‚Äôm happy with how it works right now but there‚Äôs a minor annoyance I have with it. The blog posts are arranged according to their dates by putting the date in the file name.

Yuck.1

I tried using an associative array to do it at first, but I found it difficult to sort the dates with the sort program. I‚Äôll figure it out eventually.

If you have any suggestions email me or send a pull request :).

  1. I have since implemented what I call ‚Äúghetto sorting‚Äù. It‚Äôs not pretty but it works‚Ü©Ô∏é

item.title: February 2023 Review
item.description:
I‚Äôve made more progress than I did last month. Some areas are essentially ‚Äúdone‚Äù but what‚Äôs left is to build habits around them. I won‚Äôt talk about some areas but that‚Äôs because there‚Äôs either no progress or no notable progress.

Productivity

I‚Äôm happy with the current system I have. It does exactly what I want it to. I‚Äôm not fully used to all parts of it but that‚Äôll come with time. One new thing I want to try is batching. This is because when I work on things for extended periods of time(4+ hours) I feel more productive. The task switching costs for my normal days seem to be a lot of wasted time.

In other news, my kms is out. It‚Äôs empty right now, but I will be adding to it over time.

Relationships

The framework I use for this is satisfactory. It still feels uncomfortable and I don‚Äôt always follow through. My intuition is that this is because it‚Äôs a foreign thing for me, so I‚Äôll try to power through and hope it gets easier with time. If it doesn‚Äôt I‚Äôll have to make some modifications to the system.

Programming

Programming is hard. I‚Äôve realized that I know quite a few programming languages but I don‚Äôt know them well enough to use them in a real project. Case in point my project Homebase. I decided to use Go for this project but there was too much resistance when I was building it. It felt like I was fighting against the language. What I‚Äôve decided to do is to build a prototype in Python first and then build the real project in Go. I am still doing my boosts of course, when I‚Äôm done doing them I will release them on Github.

School

The current system is good enough. I have taken a bit of a different approach of how I use it though. Normally, what I would do is I would try and fit exactly what the lecturer says or their slides into the flashcards. It worked but there was too much fluff so now what I do is, I ‚Äúprune‚Äù my notes before making flashcards.

Something Interesting I‚Äôm Thinking About

I forget how I came across the concept of an exokernel but it‚Äôs been stuck in my head ever since. In simple terms, an exokernel is a minimalist operating system architecture that gives applications direct access to hardware resources for optimized performance and flexibility. From that, I‚Äôm sure a plethora of reasons come to mind about why this would be a bad idea. I just think it would be a fun thing to build.

Overall, this month was better than last month.

I wouldn‚Äôt mind if every month was like this

item.title: January 2023 Review
item.description:
I haven‚Äôt made much headway with my goals for this year. Most of the month was spent figuring out how to structure things. I‚Äôve figured out some things about myself and some external factors have also changed. My school for example, decided to change the schedule of how school is going to be attended so I had to adapt.

Productivity

I significantly modified and streamlined my Life Management System(LMS). This has resulted in me doing more every week. There are still things I have to figure out about myself when it comes to working on personal projects. I have a pattern where I work in ‚Äúbursts‚Äù and then I don‚Äôt do anything for a while. I‚Äôm going to try and see if I can work on things more consistently, but if I can‚Äôt I‚Äôll have to find a way to use this to my advantage. There are other systems that I have added that are not public yet because they‚Äôre still being fleshed out. A Knowledge Management System(KMS) and a Zettelkasten that I will use to post things that don‚Äôt warrant a blog post.

Relationships

I managed to call people I normally would never call and I‚Äôve added some reminders to call people so I don‚Äôt forget. I plan to continue this next month and do more. I‚Äôve also scheduled group calls with friends, so I have people to talk to outside of family and work friends.

Programming

I‚Äôve started projects I call ‚Äúboosts‚Äù. I pilfered the idea from rwxrob. The general idea is they‚Äôre supposed to get me or someone like me to a point where they know and have used certain techniques. So in the case of python_boost, I‚Äôve learned how to use decorators properly and I have a project where I‚Äôm going to use it so the general idea sticks in my head. They will be made available on my github so keep an eye out.

Money

Outside of Fiverr I‚Äôm talking to some people but nothing concrete yet so fingers crossed.

Other Skills

I suspect I‚Äôve made zero progress here. When it comes to creative writing, I would classify it as a ‚Äúwicked domain‚Äù, as described by David Epstein in Range. I‚Äôm not sure if becoming good, is a matter of deliberate practice alone but I‚Äôm sure it helps. I‚Äôll read some books about writing and see what comes of it. I‚Äôll also analyze writing that I like and see what I can take from them. In the case of the other creative outlet, I‚Äôve made no progress there as well. I‚Äôm tempted to start making electronic music instead of waiting to get a guitar. If I don‚Äôt get an electric guitar by June I‚Äôll start that instead.

School

I didn‚Äôt add this to my goals for this year because it wasn‚Äôt but I want to try harder at school. Yes, I‚Äôve made a system for this too. I did have one already but it wasn‚Äôt clearly defined. I basically took notes and made flashcards that I studied a day to exams. I managed to get A+s in subjects I liked but did abysmally even in difficult subjects I liked.

All in all, it‚Äôs been a good month but I‚Äôll try to do better next month.

item.title: July 2023 Review
item.description:
This is my worst month so far. The general theme has been ‚Äúreactionary‚Äù.

Productivity

My productivity level is satisfactory. I‚Äôm not as disciplined as I want to be but I‚Äôm getting there.

My Life Management System(LMS) is at a place I‚Äôm happy with right now. There might be slight tweaks in the future but I consider the project done. Expect an article on that soon :).

Relationships

This time I have negative feelings about this area. I didn‚Äôt make time for the people I care about. And I haven‚Äôt been straightforward with people.

A regression, to be sure, but all I can do is try to be better.

Programming

Progress has been made here. I have dedicated time to learning and I‚Äôm sticking to it as best as I can. The results will speak for themselves :).

Money

There has been no progress on making extra money. On the bright side, I‚Äôve made progress on managing the money I do have. Speaking of money, most people seem really weird about it. Maybe ‚Äúpocket watching‚Äù is the best way to describe it. It‚Äôs made me consider not talking about it publicly anymore.

On the other hand, maybe it‚Äôs a good way to filter out certain people from my life.

Other skills

I‚Äôve downloaded Ardour and I‚Äôm playing around with it. Don‚Äôt expect an EDM album anytime soon though.

I‚Äôm not sure how to gauge if my writing is improving or not. Maybe you can tell?

Overall, not a bad month, but not a great one either. I‚Äôll try to do better next month.

item.title: June 2023 Review
item.description:
Halfway there.

Productivity

Considering where I was in January, I have positive feelings about this. I still use org files but things are a little different. I‚Äôm more confident with the system, and I‚Äôm doing more things. I haven‚Äôt necessarily been doing the right things, but again, progress has been made. There‚Äôs room for improvement.

Relationships

This is another one where I have positive feelings. I‚Äôve called people I cared about and I made time for activities with them. I wasn‚Äôt as consistent as I wanted to be but again, progress.

Programming

This is where things start to go downhill. I have improved, but not as much as I wanted to. On top of that, most of my improvement weren‚Äôt from deliberate learning, which I don‚Äôt like. I also have nothing to show for it outside of work. Radical change will need to be made for me to be happy with this.

Money

This is another one I‚Äôm happy about. I‚Äôm not making my goal of $2000/month. I‚Äôm not even making my goal of $1000 month. I still want to make $2000/month. My current job is flexible enough that it‚Äôs possible if I do more online gigs. Even if I don‚Äôt get to $2000/month, the fact that I‚Äôve made progress makes me happy. It‚Äôs better than $0/month.

Other skills

I‚Äôve made zero progress in this area. I‚Äôm not sure how I feel about that. I think I can still make time for these things. I don‚Äôt think my writing has improved at all. There‚Äôs no excuse. I haven‚Äôt tried to actively improve. I haven‚Äôt bought a guitar yet, so I‚Äôm considering diving into EDM production and seeing how I like it.

I‚Äôm happy with how the year has gone overall but improvements can be made.

item.title: March 2023 Review
item.description:
This was a great month. I haven‚Äôt built as many great habits as I wanted to but I‚Äôm trying and these things take time.

Money

I landed a job with a company called Blue Torus. The pay is good, the hours are amazing and I get to work with cool people. I‚Äôm still a ways from my goal of $2000 a month but this is stable income, which is a big improvement from only doing freelancing gigs. I am still freelancing though, the hours for the job are flexible enough that I can do that.

Productivity

One thing I‚Äôve decided to add to my productivity system is my finances. I‚Äôve decided to take my finances a bit more seriously so I can be more responsible with my money. The tool is a bit of a problem right now though. I want to use something like Ledger in combination with ledger-mode because it deals with plaintext files, but I have to learn it a little bit before it can become useful. I was torn between that and using something like GNUCash so I‚Äôm trying it out first. If it doesn‚Äôt work I‚Äôll use GNUCash or maybe even just org tables.

Programming

Unfortunately, I haven‚Äôt made too much progress on this. I haven‚Äôt been able to consistently work on the projects that I‚Äôve created to up my skills. I did do some work on the Homebase prototype and I‚Äôve learned more about React and NextJS which my new job requires. It‚Äôs not all bad but this will be one of my main focal points moving forward.

The dark lining in the silver cloud

Maybe a week after I started my new job, I was pickpocketed. I didn‚Äôt lose any money but I did lose my phone. I got a replacement the next day, it‚Äôs a worse phone but it‚Äôll do for now.

Great month overall.

Unlike last month I would mind if every month went like this. Can‚Äôt be losing my phone every month.

item.title: May 2023 Review
item.description:
This was another rough month. To a lesser extent than last month, but still‚Ä¶

My main focus was work and writing exams this month. It was less rough because the exams are spaced out differently and they don‚Äôt take as much time as a class.

Productivity

I‚Äôve become more productive but I‚Äôve noticed that most of the things I‚Äôm doing aren‚Äôt directly related to my goals. Things are getting done but not the most important things. I didn‚Äôt think I‚Äôd have this problem so it‚Äôs something to think about.

I don‚Äôt have anything else to say about other areas of my life. Things have been the same since last month. I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs a good thing.

Yes, you didn‚Äôt read the date wrong. I almost didn‚Äôt want to write this but I had to. I‚Äôll write the next one on time and we‚Äôll continue like nothing happened.

item.title: Money vs Passion
item.description:
Growing up, I‚Äôve always had a unique relationship with money. While I didn‚Äôt grow up ‚Äúrich‚Äù, money was never a thing I had to think about. Sometimes I got what I wanted, other times my parents told me it was outside of their budget and I understood(even if I was mad).

I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm unique in feeling like this, but some part of me felt like trying to make money with programming was bad. It felt like programming with the express goal of making money was bad. In my mind, programming was this pure ‚Äúthing‚Äù and using it solely to pursue money dirtied it.I even saw people who did that as dirty as well. Sure they could do what they wanted but I cringed whenever they would call themselves programmers or god forbid ‚Äúsoftware engineers‚Äù because they weren‚Äôt ‚Äúreal programmers‚Äù like me.

Keep in mind, this is me at around fourteen years old. Eleven years have passed since then and I‚Äôve changed a lot. I‚Äôve come to understand that wanting to make a lot of money isn‚Äôt a bad thing. If programming helps someone achieve that, then more power to them.

A few days ago I read an article my Pieter Levels called How I build my minimum viable products. I read it because I‚Äôve been thinking about ways to make money with programming. I think it‚Äôs a helpful article and if you want to do a similar thing to what he‚Äôs doing, go read it. One part of the article caught my attention.

Programming is not my passion. Making stuff is my passion.

I felt a little uncomfortable reading that. The making stuff part I can understand because, of course, I want to make stuff, but I think I still agreed with fourteen year old me on some level. So I decided to sit down and think about why it made me feel uncomfortable beyond it dirtying programming and I came up with an answer that felt right.

Should I sell out?

It felt like it was an either or choice. One thing that changed my mind a little was this stream by George Hotz titled what is programming? (noob lessons!). In the stream he makes a differentiation between a thing he calls ‚ÄúHigh Brow Software Engineering‚Äù and ‚ÄúTranslating business requirements into code‚Äù. We call both of them programming but they‚Äôre different things. I think the latter is self explanatory but the former is best explained by George here.

The conclusion I came to was that I can do both. One can be a thing I do for work and the other can be something I do for fun. The thing that I will keep in mind is that while I am ‚Äúselling out‚Äù I‚Äôm still going to be selective in the things that I build. I‚Äôm not going to build yet another AI tool that uses OpenAI‚Äôs APIs for example.

While the things I‚Äôm passionate about may not bring money in the short term, I think I should still do them because I enjoy them. On the other hand, I need money so I will ‚Äúsell out‚Äù at least for a time and create products that people want to use. The hope will be that in the future I can spend more time on the programming I enjoy and less time on the one I don‚Äôt enjoy.

From now on you‚Äôll be seeing a lot of projects that I will be working on. Some of them will be products designed to make me money and some will be things I think are cool. While I‚Äôm doing this, I will be on the lookout for something that is both fun and profitable.

Hopefully I find it.

item.title: November 2023 Review
item.description:
This month was for resting. I didn‚Äôt push myself as hard as I could on most days. I felt a little guilty because of this, but I think it‚Äôs good. It was a well earned rest after going full throttle for quite a while.

Productivity

I wasn‚Äôt as productive as I was last month but because my baseline productivity has increased, I‚Äôm not too worried about this.

Relationships

I spent time with the people I cared about when I could, so I‚Äôm good on this front.

Programming

I‚Äôve had time to think about this quite a bit and to decide my direction going forward. I know it sounds confusing but you‚Äôll understand after you read the next article.

In terms of doing programming itself, I didn‚Äôt program as much as last month.

Money

Money was a little tight this month, but I was able to stay afloat. I‚Äôll also be talking about it in the next article.

Oh I did create a whole system to manage my finances though. I call it the Personal Finance System(PFS). I won‚Äôt go into it right now because I still consider it a work in progress but it‚Äôs basically a system to manage money based on sound advice but also catering to my specific idiosyncrasies.

Other skills

I didn‚Äôt put as much effort into this like everything else, but I‚Äôve found a way to schedule them in my calendar as they are becoming a bit much to manage. I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll pick up others along the way but they will be put on the back burner until I drop any of the current ones.

Decent month overall. I think I‚Äôm ready to start going hard again but I‚Äôll try not to get too close to the sun üôÇ.

item.title: October 2023 Review
item.description:
It was tough balancing, school, work and freelance gigs but I managed to do it. Now school is off the plate so we can redirect energy elsewhere.

Productivity

This is the most productive I‚Äôve ever been. However, it was mostly fueled by coffee, red bull and dread. So in other words, not sustainable. A strange thing that has happened as a result of this is that I feel like I‚Äôve ‚Äúunlocked‚Äù something. I‚Äôll have to think about it a bit more but my it feels like my baseline productivity has improved as a result.

Relationships

I was busy but not busy enough to not make time. I could‚Äôve done better. I‚Äôll try to do better next month.

Programming

I‚Äôve done a lot of programming this month. I‚Äôm not sure if that translates to me being better but it‚Äôs something.

Money

I made some extra money this month. It came with added stress but it was worth it. Now that I‚Äôm done with school I can put in more effort into getting money.

Other skills

I‚Äôm still learning how to make music with Ardour. It might be the hardest thing I‚Äôve had to learn. It just feels foreign to me and there‚Äôs so much to take in.

I‚Äôm also learning how to draw and UI/UX design. I‚Äôm learning drawing for fun but I‚Äôm learning UI/UX design to be able to build web apps from end to end instead of just being able to code a design.

Overall, good month. I‚Äôm still reeling from the roller coaster that was last month but I think I‚Äôll be 100% soon and things will be back to normal.

item.title: September 2023 Review
item.description:
This month was rough. I say ‚Äúthis month‚Äù but clearly some of it bled into October. My main focus was school. Specifically, finishing my final year project. I also took on some extra work, thinking I could handle it, and I did. But I had to pull a few all-nighters to make sure everything got done. That took a huge toll on me physically and mentally.

Hopefully this is the worst month of this year.

Let‚Äôs try again.
